intro: Phymatodes laciniata, commonly known as the fringed phymatode, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often lobed or toothed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Phymatodes laciniata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and canyons.
